meanings.definition: To call too often or too loudly
meanings.sent1: The excited puppy kept overcalling for attention.
meanings.sent2: She overcalls her friend every day after school.
meanings.sent3: The parrot overcalling for crackers was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: His overcalling for help echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The overcalling of the alarm made it impossible to ignore.

meanings.definition: To make excessive or exaggerated claims
meanings.sent1: The politician was overcalling his achievements during the speech.
meanings.sent2: Don't overcall your abilities; be honest with yourself.
meanings.sent3: His overcalling of being the best singer was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: She tends to overcall her experience in the field.
meanings.sent5: The salesman's overcalling of the product's benefits seemed too good to be true.

meanings.definition: A call that is too high in pitch or volume
meanings.sent1: The soprano's overcalling in the opera was breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: The overcalling of the referee disrupted the game.
meanings.sent3: The bird's overcalling in the morning was a cheerful wake-up call.
meanings.sent4: The overcalling of the megaphone made everyone cover their ears.
meanings.sent5: The overcalling of the trumpet pierced through the concert hall.
